image.altText: A woman stands under an archway looking at the camera with a stern expression.

props.synopsis: Sue-Belinda Meehan believes education reforms in recent years have done more harm than good, and backs a Senate committee's recommendations to bring back some traditional approaches.

title.children: Teacher who had leg broken by student says classroom behaviour is only getting worse

image.altText: Proud parents Tina Lee and Tom Bueno with baby Henry

props.synopsis: Tina thought she would never see her baby son again after her health deteriorated eight years after a double lung transplant. But behind the scenes, her medical team was thinking "outside the box".

title.children: Tina never thought she would be the 'dying mum of a five-day-old'. Months later, her life 'really is a fairytale'

image.altText: A coal-fired power plant

props.synopsis: New research shows global carbon emissions from fossil fuels have increased over the past year despite most of the world committing to net zero targets.

title.children: Global emissions at record highs as world continues to overspend on 'carbon budget'

image.altText: A man in a suit on a laptop searching real estate websites.

props.synopsis: More people looking to break into the property market are lying on their loan applications in a desperate bid to try to secure a home loan, according to new data. The struggle to refinance is also getting harder with more interest rate rises in 2024 possible.

title.children: 'People can be very creative': Inside the rise of 'liar loans' in Australia's property market

image.altText: dark concert hall filled with people and stage lit up

props.synopsis: The 1,200-capacity precinct will help attract big-name acts, but will the region's lack of nightlife and public transport issues hold it back?

title.children: A year after being mothballed, the Sunshine Coast's biggest live music venue is being resurrected

image.altText: A hand holding cannabis

props.synopsis: More people are using medical cannabis than ever before, but some health professionals are concerned that the explosion in clinics and online services may not meet the holistic approach to healthcare.

title.children: Pharmacist says 70pc of clients are black market users switching to legal cannabis supply

image.altText: Andrew O'Keefe wears suit and tie walks on Sydney street

props.synopsis: The former television host was given a good behaviour bond after he returned a positive drug test earlier this year from a police stop.

title.children: Andrew O'Keefe pleads guilty to drug-driving after methamphetamine use in Sydney

image.altText: Brittany Higgins walking with a friend and her fiance on either side of her.

props.synopsis: While under cross-examination as part of Bruce Lehrmann's defamation action, Brittany Higgins says she was drunkenly skipping in Parliament House with no shoes on.

title.children: Brittany Higgins denies lying about being '10 out of 10 drunk' on the night of her alleged rape

image.altText: Annastacia stands up in state parliament and speaks while wearing a black blazer.

props.synopsis: As a state government, sometimes a good old-fashioned fight with the feds can pay off politically, especially in a parochial state like Queensland, writes Jessica van Vonderen.

title.children: Annastacia Palaszczuk is a premier on the ropes and the punches keep coming

image.altText: A medium photo of a middle-aged man with receding hair and beard, wearing a singlet and glasses

props.synopsis: The Coalition says the government was "asleep at the wheel" when the High Court ruled indefinite immigration detention unlawful, and that two ministers should resign or be sacked after one man released from immigration detention weeks ago was charged with two counts of indecent assault.

title.children: Government rejects calls for O'Neil and Giles to resign after released detainee charged with indecent assault

image.altText: A man wearing a blue, black and white shirt playing the guitar to two young children

props.synopsis: Kev Mauger suffered horrific head trauma and injuries after being catapulted over his motorcycle handlebars four years ago. Despite being told he would never play guitar again, his love for music has been key in his recovery.

title.children: Music helps Kev find his voice again after near-fatal motorcycle accident

image.altText: Neville Devete wears a floral collared shirt and looks seriously at the camera in an office.

props.synopsis: A Papua New Guinean lawyer who fled to Australia after blowing the whistle on one of the Pacific nation's biggest corruption scandals is awarded a prestigious free speech prize.

title.children: Lawyer who fled to Australia after blowing whistle in PNG's biggest corruption scandal wins free speech prize

image.altText: Woman with her back to the camera

props.synopsis: An unlicensed business has been fined more than $600,000, the largest penalty in Australian labour hire licensing law history, for repeatedly supplying underpaid workers to horticulture sites around Melbourne.

title.children: 'Dodgy' labour hire company hit with record fine over underpayment, mistreatment of workers

image.altText: Cate Campbell hugs Bronte Campbell. They each have a medal around their neck.

props.synopsis: With no host in place for the 2026 Commonwealth Games and an increasingly bleak outlook of finding one after the Gold Coast withdrew its speculative bid to save it, we may have seen the last of the old Empire Games. But could it be kept alive for the athletes of tomorrow?

title.children: The Commonwealth Games is on its last legs — but could it be saved with a left-field idea?

image.altText: A young man in a white shirt clapping

props.synopsis: "Swiftie" and "prompt" are among the words to have missed out on the Oxford Dictionary's top gong, which has gone to "Rizz" — a shortening of the word charisma.

title.children: 'Rizz' named Oxford Dictionary's word of the year

image.altText: Woman wearing grey cardigan, white shirt and mask stands in front of a crowd of cameras.

props.synopsis: Agnes Chow, one of the city's best-known activists, was arrested following 2019 anti-government protests. She says will weigh up her next steps, including seeking asylum.

title.children: After fleeing to Canada, pro-democracy activist says she will not return to Hong Kong

image.altText: RFDS nurses wear high visibility jackets that say "fair go for RFDS nurses".

props.synopsis: They provide lifesaving emergency care in remote areas but according to their union, nurses working for the Royal Flying Doctor Service in Queensland are paid less than their public hospital colleagues.

title.children: Queensland's flying nurses take a hi-vis approach as row over pay hangs in the air

image.altText: Resuers carry a man on a stretcher through trees on the island of Sumatra.

props.synopsis: At least 11 hikers were killed following the eruption of Indonesia's Mount Marapi and now families of those who remain missing face an anxious wait as weather conditions and fears of further eruptions slow search and rescue efforts.

title.children: Rescuers face 'very difficult' task to find missing hikers after deadly Indonesian volcanic eruption

image.altText: A man cutting stone for a kitchen benchtop

props.synopsis: New research shows silica is not the only component in engineered stone products that's a cause for concern, with researchers finding higher metal content in alternative products can also damage the lungs.

title.children: 'Not just about silica': Study finds alternatives to engineered stone bench tops may not be safe

image.altText: A child looks to the side as a woman cooks food over fire in a crowded tent camp

props.synopsis: Intense Israeli air strikes hit the south of the Gaza Strip, killing and wounding dozens of Palestinians, as Israeli troops and tanks extend their ground campaign against Hamas militants into the south of the enclave.

title.children: Gaza under phone and internet blackout as Israel widens offensive

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: WHO says it has been given 24 hours to move supplies from medical warehouse, IDF denies
Israeli forces kill 5 Palestinians in West Bank, health ministry says
Gaza death toll is two civillians to every Hamas militant, Israel says

image.altText: A satellite imagery of the world's largest iceberg, named A23a, seen in Antarctica.

props.synopsis: Days after scientists declared the enormous iceberg was on the move, a research team documents their "incredibly lucky" encounter with the almost 4,000-square-kilometre berg as it drifts out of Antarctica.

title.children: New footage captures world's largest iceberg on the move, escaping Antarctica after decades grounded

image.altText: Two female soldiers inspect a drone

props.synopsis: This is hardly the first time a military institution has dismissed the capacity of a potential adversary with catastrophic outcomes. And it is not the first time for Israel, writes Mick Ryan.

title.children: Israel may have known about Hamas' plan to attack a year ago. But it's not the first time it has misjudged a threat

image.altText: Justice Gregory Geason looks off camera.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's attorney-general is "deeply" considering the future of Supreme Court Judge Gregory Geason, who appeared in the Hobart Magistrates Court on criminal charges, with press freedom advocates condemning the barring of media from the courtroom.

title.children: Future of judge charged with assault in the balance, as press freedom advocates rail against ban on media in court

image.altText: A woman in a red soccer jersey.

props.synopsis: Around 45,000 people are expected to attend the Matildas and Canada friendly clash on Wednesday, as Christine Sinclair calls time on her celebrated career.

title.children: Matildas prepared for emotionally charged clash with Canada as football legend farewells the game

image.altText: Winona Ryder and Angeline Jolie on the set of Girl Interupted

props.synopsis: If you've seen A Beautiful Mind, Psycho or Fatal Attraction, you've seen how not to depict mental illness on the silver screen, according to experts. Here's what they say about getting it right.

title.children: 'It's OK to show messy humanity on screen': Striking the right note with mental health in film

image.altText: Mitchell Johnson

props.synopsis: Former Australian Test star Mitchell Johnson says a column he wrote in April this year sparked an ugly feud with former teammate David Warner.

title.children: Johnson reveals spark that ignited feud with Warner, and swipes 'childish' Bailey over comments

image.altText: Simon Birmingham.

props.synopsis: Shadow Minister for Foreign Affairs Simon Birmingham says Labor cut $3.2 billion from the foreign aid budget in October 2022 only to put it back in in the most recent budget. Is that correct? RMIT ABC Fact Check investigates.

title.children: Did Labor cut $3.2 billion from foreign aid then claim credit for putting it back in?

image.altText: Two men outside a burning building.

props.synopsis: Police release footage of an arson attack on a Docklands restaurant that detectives believe is linked to a series of fires at tobacco stores across Melbourne.

title.children: Police believe restaurant arson linked to Melbourne's tobacco store fires

image.altText: Primary aged school stduents with school logo green backpacks walk along a city street

props.synopsis: It's that time of year when it seems the more school fees parents pay, the less time their children spend in school. Why the differences?

title.children: Why do private schools get more holidays than public schools?

image.altText: Tim Barrett speaking at an event in military dress

props.synopsis: The navy removed a requirement for "value for money" from the tender process for its $45 billion future frigate program, with previously secret documents also revealing the Department of Defence selected a controversial British warship design despite being aware of potential risks.

title.children: Previously secret report raises doubts about $45 billion Defence program

image.altText: An elderly couple stand in front of their motor home

props.synopsis: Maggie and Mal Butcher spent years on the road after selling their house. But while they love their camper, ill health has slowed them down and they now live in a friend's backyard — which means facing the ire of local council.

title.children: Grey nomad couple with nowhere to go call for council compassion on backyard camping

image.altText: An RBA logo on hand sanitiser in the foyer at the Reserve Bank of Australia headquarters

props.synopsis: The local share market falls from a 10-week high ahead of the Reserve Bank's board meeting, which is likely to result in interest rates staying on hold. Follow live.

title.children: ASX falls ahead of Reserve Bank decision, Wall Street rally loses steam as gold falls from record high

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Optus outage inquiry final report delayed until February 2024
Spotify axes 17pc of its workforce to save costs, despite recording a profit
Virgin Australia cabin crew vote to strike over pay and conditions ahead of Christmas season

image.altText: Map of Queensland and the Coral Sea showing possible cyclone paths.

props.synopsis: The BOM says a tropical low over the Solomon Islands is likely to develop into a severe storm that might head our way.

title.children: Potential cyclone brewing over Coral Sea could cross Australian coast

image.altText: Nine year old Toby Jamieson sitting in front of greenery, wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: The National Disability Insurance Scheme lost an estimated $1.4 billion through "payment errors" including fraud and over-claiming last financial year, a five-fold increase from two years ago.

title.children: An estimated $1.4 billion of NDIS funding was lost to fraud in a year. For Toby's family, it's a 'colossal waste'

image.altText: Beverley Wang, with shoulder length black hair, black shirt and slight smile, looks at camera, against a blurred background.

props.synopsis: From strange intimacy to the thrill of the unpredictable, radio offers something no other form of media can match.

title.children: Drunk guests, strange intimacy and profound trust: What's behind our love affair with radio?
